an2.63:1.1: Var readings vacisamhara, vacisamsara, vacisankhara: MN 103 Comm: Vacīsaṁhāroti vacanasañcāro. Imehi kathitaṁ amūsaṁ antaraṁ paveseyya, tumhe imehi idañcidañca vuttāti amūhi kathitaṁ imesaṁ antaraṁ paveseyyāti attho, Tika: Vacanasañcāroti pesuññavasena aññathāvacanupasaṁhāro. The parallel passage is at AN 2.63, where samsara is the MS reading, and adopted by BB there. Comm there gives a completely different explanation: ubhato vacīsaṁsāroti dvīsupi pakkhesu aññamaññaṁ akkosanapaccakkosanavasena saṁsaramānā vācā vacīsaṁsāro. Tika has: Saṁsaramānāti pavattamānā. Despite this, I think the reading samhara makes better sense, as per MN comm.
